}} 'Histone H3' is one of the five main histone proteins involved in the
structure of chromatin in eukaryotic cells. Featuring a main globular domain and a
long N-terminal tail, H3 is involved with the structure of the nucleosomes of
the 'beads on a string' structure. Histone proteins are highly post-
translationally modified however Histone H3 is the most extensively modified of
the five histones. The term "Histone H3" alone is purposely ambiguous in that it
does not distinguish between sequence variants or modification state. Histone H3
is an important protein in the emerging field of epigenetics, where its sequence
variants and variable modification states are thought to play a role in the
dynamic and long term regulation of genes.
